titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Long Islander clippings collection 1985.040
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:17:38 +0000.

did.abstract: The Long Islander clippings collection spans the period 1847 to 1889 and contains an assortment of clippings from the newspaper documenting death and marriages. The Long Islander was founded in 1838 by the poet Walt Whitman, and as of 2015, it continues to publish as a weekly newspaper covering the town of Huntington, Long Island, New York.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Long Islander clippings collection, 1985.040, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1985.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Clippings are in the public domain.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level by Matthew Gorham on August 19, 2011. Rehoused by John Zarrillo in December 2015.
